markdownRemark.html:
A dialogue may, at its best, shed light upon a subject from at least two spots - at worst it could be the senseless mumble of two dim-witted dodderers. The fine Greek tradition of dialectics has shown nonetheless that 2-way communication can progress a chain of thought rather efficiently. Hesitan and Miracles, though would be the last to admit that.

Slightly phased-off and yet always good for an insight, these two strange friends share some deep thoughts in a not too distant future, where humanity begins to understand that everything is possible and everything must be considered with just that premise.
